info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 12:59PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL AND EAST CENTRAL SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 130 PM MDT... At 1259 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Canada De Los Alamos, or 8 miles southeast of Santa Fe, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eastern Santa Fe, Eldorado At Santa Fe, Canada De Los Alamos, Lamy and Glorieta. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 283 and 302. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 284 and 290. State Road 63 between Mile Markers 10 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
